intro: Rollandia lanceolata var. brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed lanceleaf arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces edible tubers that are similar in texture to yams and are used in various culinary preparations. Botanically, it belongs to the family Araceae and is known for its rhizomatous growth habit. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated for both its ornamental value and nutritional benefits.
